metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40574 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP),released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to anOut-Of-Bounds Write in the `writePixelBGRX` function. This issue is likelydown to incorrect calculations of the `nHeight` and `srcStep` variables.This issue has been addressed in version 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised toupgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libuwac0-0 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
winpr-utils - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1').
